record.dc:title: 16MCL6, 15MCL6, McLean County, Kentucky. Eaton Site. Feature Nos. 3 and 5.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: En bloc view of house structure (Feature #3) with the top outline of the house floor indicated (Feature #5). The top of the posthole trench is indicated by a line of limestone rocks so placed for photographic purposes only. Clearly indicated are the postholes in the lateral trenches and the postmolds of driven corner posts. On the right side of the picture is the reconstructed south corner of the foundations which was destroyed by rain and thawing. In the background is the L&N Railroad track. This view is taken from the west corner. From Notes: Weather -- cloudy (4:15 pm). Adjustments -- f 32, 1 second. Subject -- House structure (Feature #3) en bloc, after taking median section through trenches of this structure and cleaning out postholes. Destroyed South corner reconstructed by extending strings and also destroyed postholes represented by tubes of newspaper (the tips remained visible). Feature #5 also. Limestone rocks demark Feature #3 trend. Camera position -- taken from the west corner of Feature #3.
